title: Frequently Asked Questions
description: Have questions about admissions? Weâ€™ve answered the most common ones below.

questions.question: What are the eligibility requirements for admission?
questions.answer: Most programs require Matriculation with Science (Biology preferred). Some specialized courses may also consider Physics and Chemistry.

questions.question: How do I apply for admission?
questions.answer: You can apply directly through our online application form or visit the Admissions Office on campus. Required documents must be submitted before the deadline.

questions.question: What documents are needed for admission?
questions.answer: Applicants typically need: Matric/Intermediate certificates & transcripts, copy of CNIC / B-Form, recent passport-size photographs, Any other documents specified by the program or required by the admission office.

questions.question: Is there an entrance test or interview?
questions.answer: Yes. Depending on the program, candidates may be required to appear for an entrance test and/or interview to assess eligibility.

questions.question: What is the duration of the courses?
questions.answer: Most paramedical diploma programs are 2 years in duration. Some may vary depending on specialization.

questions.question: Are scholarships or financial aid available?
questions.answer: Yes. We offer merit-based scholarships and limited Need-based financial assistance. Details are available at the Admissions Office.

questions.question: When does the academic session begin?
questions.answer: New sessions typically begin in September each year. Exact dates are announced on our website and notice boards.

questions.question: What career opportunities will I have after completing a course?
questions.answer: Graduates can work in hospitals, clinics, diagnostic centers, and laboratories. Many also pursue higher education or specialized certifications.
